headline: Huntington Bancshares Incorporated Declares Quarterly Cash Dividends On Its Common and Preferred Stocks
summary: Huntington Bancshares Incorporated announced that the Board of Directors declared a quarterly cash dividend on the company's common stock (Nasdaq: HBAN) of $0.155 per common share, unchanged from the prior quarter. The common stock cash dividend is payable July 1, 2025, to shareholders of record on June 17, 2025.

headline: Huntington's Q1 profit rises as Fed rate cuts temper deposit costs
summary: U.S. President Donald Trump's trade policies have sparked concerns about rising inflation and a potential recession, prompting the bank to set aside a bigger buffer to cover loans that might not be repaid.  Huntington's provision for credit losses was $115 million, higher than $107 million from a year earlier.  Its net interest income - the difference between what a bank earns as interest on loans and pays out on deposits - jumped to $1.43 billion in the first quarter, compared with $1.29 billion a year earlier.

headline: Huntington Bancshares (HBAN) Beats Q1 Earnings and Revenue Estimates
summary: Huntington Bancshares (HBAN) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of 9.68% and 2.10%, respectively, for the quarter ended March 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Huntington Bancshares: Q1 Earnings Snapshot
summary: COLUMBUS, Ohio (AP) — Huntington Bancshares Inc. HBAN) on Thursday reported first-quarter net income of $527 million. The Columbus, Ohio-based bank said it had earnings of 34 cents per share.

headline: Huntington Bancshares Incorporated Reports 2025 First-Quarter Earnings
summary: Huntington Bancshares Incorporated (Nasdaq: HBAN) reported net income for the 2025 first quarter of $527 million, or $0.34 per common share, a decrease of $3 million from the prior quarter, and an increase of $108 million, or 26%, from the year-ago quarter.
